item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "If music be the food of love, play on, Give me excess of it; that surfeiting, The appetite may sicken, and so die." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbors, and laugh at them in our turn?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is not everyone,' said Elinor, 'who has your passion for dead leaves." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A woman, especially if she have the misfortune of knowing anything, should conceal it as well as she can." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Seldom, very seldom, does complete truth belong to any human disclosure; seldom can it happen that something is not a little disguised or a little mistaken." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "Once upon a time there was a boy who loved a girl, and her laughter was a question he wanted to spend his whole life answering." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "She [my mother] was the force around which our world turned. My mother was propelled through the universe by the brute force of reason. She was the judge in all our arguments. One disapproving word from her was enough to send us off to hide in a corner, where we would cry and fantasize our own martyrdom. And yet. One kiss could restore us to princedom. Without her, our lives would dissolve into chaos." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "...larger than life...I've never understood that expression. What's larger than life?" -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "I know there is a moral to this story, but I don't know what it is." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "ONE THING I AM NEVER GOING TO DO WHEN I GROW UP Is fall in love, drop out of college, learn to subsist on water and air, have a species named after me, and ruin my life." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "You speak an infinite deal of nothing." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Lord, what fools these mortals be!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by William Shakespeare
Suzanne add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The first thing we do, let's kill all the lawyers." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "I would challenge you to a battle of wits, but I see you are unarmed!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Conscience doth make cowards of us all." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "He that hath a beard is more than a youth, and he that hath no beard is less than a man. He that is more than a youth is not for me, and he that is less than a man, I am not for him." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Suzanne add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "To die, to sleep - To sleep, perchance to dream - ay, there's the rub, For in this sleep of death what dreams may come..." -- William Shakespeare
